knimeNode.name: Spark Column Filter
knimeNode.shortDescription: The Spark Column Filter allows columns to be excluded from the input Spark DataFrame/RDD.

fullDescription.intro: This node allows columns to be filtered from the input Spark DataFrame/RDD while only the remaining columns are passed to the output Spark DataFrame/RDD. Within the dialog, columns can be moved between the Include and Exclude list.

tab.name: Manual Selection
tab.option: This list contains the names of those columns in the input Spark DataFrame/RDD to be included in the output Spark DataFrame/RDD.
This list contains the names of those columns in the input Spark DataFrame/RDD to be excluded from the output Spark DataFrame/RDD.
Use one of these fields to filter either the Include or Exclude list for certain column names or name substrings.

Use these buttons to move columns between the Include and Exclude list. Single-arrow buttons will move all selected columns. Double-arrow buttons will move all columns (filtering is taken into account).

Select this option to enforce the current exclusion list to stay the same even if the input Spark DataFrame/RDD specification changes. If some of the excluded columns are not available anymore, a warning is displayed. (New columns will automatically be added to the inclusion list.)

Select this option to enforce the current inclusion list to stay the same even if the input Spark DataFrame/RDD specification changes. If some of the included columns are not available anymore, a warning is displayed. (New columns will automatically be added to the exclusion list.)

tab.name: Wildcard/Regex Selection
tab.option: Type a search pattern which matches columns to move into the Include list. You can use either Wildcards ('?' matching any character, '*' matching a sequence of any characters) or Regex. You can specify whether your pattern should be case sensitive.

tab.name: Type Selection
tab.option: Select the column types that you want to include. Column types that are currently not present are depicted in italic.

Java API documentation about regex matching

ports.inPort: Spark DataFrame/RDD from which columns are to be excluded.
